poem.title: Guzzle
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: If thunder's one of the seven deadly sins Then so is bragging to me about your means And sharing nothing. Show me another drunk That binges only on other people's wines. No don't: leave your wag on the wagon. Confronted with a ticket machine, in shock You pat your pockets till someone else stumps up. I leave you there. For what Depresses the dinner out of me Is that praise you lavish: It must be really cheap.
